page.title: 08MIDLEM VILLAGE
page.content: {Midlem}is a Border village in the parish of Bowden with an adult population of 92, lying on a southward slope above the valley of the river Ale. There are 44 houses and cottages round a rectangular village green, most houses opening on to the roads round the green, with large gardens behind them. {It is}sheltered by rising ground and woodland to the north, but exposed to the prevailing westerly winds. To the south there is a magnificent view over farmland and woodland to the Cheviot Hills and the English Border. {Many}of the houses are modernised cottages, and there is a former manse. Most of the people own their own houses, but there are three council houses. A blacksmith's shop stands on the village green, and there is a village hall.
